page.title: 04THE DAY OF A FARMER'S WIFE
page.content: Milking on the farm starts at 6 a.m. I rise at 7, wake Steven and Julie and have breakfast. This is followed by some housework after which I make breakfast for my husband and eldest son.The children go to school and my husband back to work. I am now available to be general factotum on the farm.Collecting eggs is my regular duty, other jobs are seasonal. At haymaking I tip the trailers into the auger and on into the bins, I also work in the barn tipping and placing bales of straw. At 10 o clock my husband and son have a break this is followed by more of the same work on the farm. After dinner there is more housework, particularly cleaning up straw brought inside.At 3 I have half an hour before the children are home and I prepare the evening meal.
